pages.text: "A simple machine used to enrich ores into two of their dust counterparts, as well as perform many other operations." $(p)The Enrichment Chamber has a lot of uses. For example, rather than getting 1 dye out of your flowers, you get 2! Need Gravel? Put in some sand and boom, you got yourself

some gravel. $(p)The Enrichment Chamber also allows you to enrich Redstone, Diamond Dust, Tin Dust, Gold Dust, Coal/Charcoal, Refined Obsidian Dust into their enriched counterparts. Doing so will make them 8x more efficient when it comes to using them for infusion. For instance, a regular redstone dust would give 10mB of redstone infusion. But an Enriched Redstone would give 80mB of redstone infusion!

pages.title: Ore Processing
pages.text: The Enrichment Chamber can also increase your ores yield:$(br)Have an ore that needs to be smelted? Don't just put it into a furnace, put it into an Enrichment Chmaber first instead! The Enrichment Chamber will turn that ore into it's dust counterpart (2 of them). Then smelt those two dusts and you get 2 ingots instead of 1! See Ore Processing (category) for more information about Mekanism's Ore Processing.

That's not it though. There are ores that don't need to be smelted, such as diamond ores. But those ores can be processed as well if you mine them out with a silk-touch enchanted pickaxe. If you mine out, say a redstone ore, with a silk-touch tool, and put that redstone ore into a Enrichment Chmaber, you get 12 Redstone Dust! That's more than the 4-5 Redstone Dust you would have otherwise gotten if you had mined it right then and there without silk-touch and processing (with Fortune 3, you
would still only get an average of 10 dust per ore).
